highlights.para: This chapter describes how to improve the performance of the MATE Desktop.

sect1.title: Introduction to Improving Performance
sect1.para: This chapter lists several preferences whose settings you can change to improve the performance of the MATE Desktop. You can use the mateconftool-2 command to set values for preferences for users. The example commands in this chapter show how to set values in the user configuration source.

You can also use the --direct and --config-source options to set mandatory values or default values for preferences. You can also use the mateconftool-2 command in a script to set the values of many preferences. For more information on the mateconftool-2 command and the options that are available with the command, see .

sect1.title: Reducing X Window System Network Traffic

indexterm.primary: X Window System network traffic, reducing

sect1.para: This section describes preferences that you can set to reduce X Window System network traffic on the MATE Desktop.

sect2.title: To Use Theme Options Which Create Less Network Traffic
sect2.para: Remote display protocols do not transfer every pixel in a block of pixels if all pixels in the block are the same color.
To reduce X Window System network traffic, use a window frame theme option that uses solid colors. That is, use one of the following window frame options:

listitem.para: Atlanta
Esco

sect2.para: For information on how to change theme options, see .

sect2.title: To Reduce Network Traffic by Turning Off Display of Icons in Menus
sect2.para: Some items in menus display an icon beside the item. If the icon is located on another file system, this feature can increase X Window System network traffic. This feature can also increase X Window System network traffic if the panels are displayed on a remote host.
For information on how to turn off this feature, see .

sect1.title: Reducing Color Usage and Improving Display Quality
sect1.para: Many modern computer systems support 24-bit color, that is, 16,777,216 colors. However, many users still use systems that support 8-bit color, that is, 256 colors.

The MATE Desktop uses the websafe color palette. This palette is a general-purpose palette of 216 colors, which is designed to optimize the use of color on systems that support 8-bit color. However, some visual components of the MATE Desktop are designed for systems that support 24-bit color.
The following display problems might occur on systems that support 8-bit color:

listitem.para: Windows, icons, and background images might appear grainy. Many themes, background images, and icons use colors that are not in the websafe color palette. The colors that are not in the palette are replaced with the nearest equivalent or a dithered approximation. This use of replacement colors causes the grainy appearance.

Applications that do not use the websafe color palette have less colors available. Color errors might occur. Some colors might not appear in the user interface of the application. Some applications might crash if the application cannot allocate colors.

Color flashing might occur when users switch between applications that use the websafe color palette, and applications that do not use this palette. The applications that do not use the websafe color palette might use a custom colormap. When the custom colormap is used, other visual components might lose colors, then become unviewable.

sect1.para: The following sections describe how to optimize the appearance of the MATE Desktop for systems that support 8-bit color.

sect2.title: To Use Theme Options That Use the Websafe Color Palette
sect2.para: Some window frame theme options use colors that are in the websafe color palette. Bright and Esco use colors from the websafe color palette. Bright and Esco do not have the grainy appearance of other window frame options on 8-bit color displays. Use Bright or Esco for the best color display on 8-bit visual modes.
For information on how to change theme options, see .

sect2.title: To Reduce Color Usage by Turning Off Display of Icons in Menus
sect2.para: Some items in menus display an icon beside the item. If the icon contains colors that are not in the websafe color palette, this feature can increase the number of colors used.
For information on how to turn off this feature, see .

sect2.title: To Reduce Color Usage by Turning Off the Splash Screen
sect2.para: You can turn off the splash screen to make more colors available for the MATE Desktop and for applications.
For information on how to turn off the splash screen, see .
